intro: Chaerophyllum hybridum, commonly known as the cow parsley or small cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. It is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a valuable plant for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
